acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.14mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals, 1999).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 130mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-41 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 640mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Cannot be classified given the insufficiency of data for use in classification along with the absence of existing classification.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF<44(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1, in accordance with the classification by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#3441, chlorodinitrobenzene (solid)).

explosives.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data on decomposition energy, though the substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -75 and the kick-off temperature of 250degC (Bretherick (J), 5th, 1998). Classified into Division 6.1 in accordance with the classification by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#0154, chlorodinitrobenzene (solid)).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though classified as "combustible" by ICSC (2000). Classified into Division 6.1, in accordance with the classification by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#3441, chlorodinitrobenzene (solid)).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ/somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ/somatic cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (reverse mutation tests and chromosome aberration tests), described in CERI Hazard Data 2000-41 (2001).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1, in accordance with the classification by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#3441, chlorodinitrobenzene (solid)).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 432degC (ICSC, 2000)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 54degC (ICSC, 2000), test temperature: 140degC)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing nitro groups. Classified into Division 6.1, in accordance with the classification by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#3441, chlorodinitrobenzene (solid)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "severe irritation" in the rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-41 (2001)). As it is unknown whether the effects are reversible or not, the substance is placed in Category 1 from the viewpoint of safety.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-41 (2001)): The substance produced "severe skin irritation." Although it is unknown whether the effects are reversible or not, the substance is placed in Category 2, given the fact that the results are those of 24- (not 4) hour application.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the animal skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-41 (2001)): "The substance causes skin sensitization."  Also based on the evidence of skin sensitization in humans (CERI Hazard Data 2000-41 (2001)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "retrobulbar neuritis" (HSDB (2002)), "may affect the nervous system and cause visual impairment" (ICSC (J) (1999)), and the evidence from animal studies including "abnormal behaviour, congestion of the visible mucosa, dyspnea, decreases in hemoglobin concentration/RBC count, sulfhemoglobinemia" (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (nervous system, blood system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (nervous system, blood system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "irritation to the eye/airway/skin, cyanosis of the lips/nails/skin, dizziness, headache, smothering feeling, nausea, vomiting, acute visual impairment," "may affect the blood system and produce methemoglobin" (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004)).
